summary.span: 代表劃分的時間，例如週、月和年。

span.span: Represents time in divisions, such as weeks, months, and years.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 行事曆分成單位，例如週、 月和年的時間。A calendar divides time into units, such as weeks, months, and years. 在每個行事曆，差異數、 長度和部門的開頭。The number, length, and start of the divisions vary in each calendar. > [!NOTE] > 如需在.NET 中使用的曆法類別資訊，請參閱[使用行事曆](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the calendar classes in .NET, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 任何時間點可以表示為一組數值資料，請使用特定的行事曆。Any moment in time can be represented as a set of numeric values using a particular calendar. 比方說，春分連接發生 (1999 年，3、 20、 8、 46、 0、 0.0) 西曆日曆，也就是年 3 月 20，1999年For example, a vernal equinox occurred at (1999, 3, 20, 8, 46, 0, 0.0) in the Gregorian calendar, that is, March 20, 1999 C.E. 在 8:46:00:0.0。at 8:46:00:0.0. 實作可以將任何日期範圍內的特定行事曆對應至一組類似的數字的值，並可以將這類的數值集對應至使用中的資訊的文字表示法和。An implementation of can map any date in the range of a specific calendar to a similar set of numeric values, and can map such sets of numeric values to a textual representation using information from and . 文字表示法可能會區分文化特性，例如，「 上午 8:46 年 3 月 20 1999 AD"EN-US 文化特性，或不區分文化特性，例如，"1999年-03-20T08:46:00"採用 ISO 8601 格式。The textual representation can be culture-sensitive, for example, "8:46 AM March 20th 1999 AD" for the en-US culture, or culture-insensitive, for example, "1999-03-20T08:46:00" in ISO 8601 format. A實作可以定義一或多個紀元。A implementation can define one or more eras. 類別會識別出的紀元為列舉的整數，其中目前的紀元 () 值是 0。The class identifies the eras as enumerated integers, where the current era () has the value 0. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 若要構成日曆年度和地球繞太陽的實際時間或月亮繞地球的實際時間之間的差異，閏年有從標準的日曆年度不同數目的天數。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每個實作以不同的方式定義潤年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 為求一致，每個間隔 （第一個月，例如） 中的第一個單位會指派值 1。For consistency, the first unit in each interval (the first month, for example) is assigned the value 1. 命名空間包含下列實作：The namespace includes the following implementations: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ## Examples 下列程式碼範例將示範成員類別。The following code example demonstrates the members of the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks `months`值會加入至指定。The `months` value is added to the specified . 如果`months`是負數，產生早於指定。If `months` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 產生的日期部分產生的日期不在產生的月份，產生的 year 的有效日期會受到影響。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它會變更為產生的 year 之產生的月份中最後一個有效的日期。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 產生的年份部分產生的月份超出指定的年份會受到影響。The year part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is outside the year of the specified . 產生的紀元一部分產生的 year 超出指定的紀元會受到影響。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 產生的日期時間部分維持不變，與指定。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，假設目前的行事曆有 12 個月，其中第四個月有 30 天和第十個月有 31 天。For example, suppose that the current calendar has 12 months, where the fourth month has 30 days and the tenth month has 31 days. 如果指定的月份是第十個月，指定某一天是該月份中，第 31 天，而`months`參數為 6，則產生的 year 是一個以上的指定年份中，產生的月份的第四個月內，而且產生的日期是 30 號日期，也就是產生的月份的最後一天。If the specified month is the tenth month, the specified day is the 31st day of that month, and the value of the `months` parameter is 6, the resulting year is one more than the specified year, the resulting month is the fourth month, and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day of the resulting month. 如果值`months`參數是負值，產生早於指定。If the value of the `months` parameter is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 屬性傳回之值一律等於。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留的屬性`time`藉由呼叫的參數方法，如下列範例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks `years`值會加入至指定。The `years` value is added to the specified . 如果`years`是負數，產生早於指定。If `years` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 產生的日期部分產生的日期不在產生的月份，產生的 year 的有效日期會受到影響。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它會變更為產生的 year 之產生的月份中最後一個有效的日期。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 產生的月份部分產生的每月不有效的月份中產生的 year 會受到影響。The month part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is not a valid month in the resulting year. 它會變更為產生的 year 中的最後一個有效月份。It is changed to the last valid month in the resulting year. 產生的紀元一部分產生的 year 超出指定的紀元會受到影響。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 產生的日期時間部分維持不變，與指定。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 比方說，西曆，二月有 28 天，除了期間是閏年時有 29 天。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, February has 28 days, except during a leap year when it has 29 days. 指定的日期是否在閏年中的 2 月 29 日，而`years`為 1，則產生的日期是在下一年度的 2 月的第 28 天。If the specified date is the 29th day of February in a leap year and the value of `years` is 1, the resulting date is the 28th day of February in the following year. 如果`years`是負數，產生早於指定。If `years` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 屬性傳回之值一律等於。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留的屬性`time`藉由呼叫的參數方法，如下列範例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks 行事曆支援閏月的概念，在特定月份或任何一年中的月之後，可能會發生的閏月。In a calendar that supports the notion of a leap month, the leap month can occur either after a particular month or after any month in a year. 比方說，方法傳回的數字，介於 1 到 13，表示指定的日期與相關聯的月份。For example, the method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. 如果年份的第八個和第九個月之間沒有閏月方法會傳回 8，第八個月內，如呈獻第八個月的 9 和 10，第九個月。If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要構成日曆年度和地球繞太陽的實際時間或月亮繞地球的實際時間之間的差異，閏年有從標準的日曆年度不同數目的天數。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每個實作以不同的方式定義潤年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 為閏日是閏年只會發生一天。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 比方說，在西曆的年 2 月 29 日是唯一的閏日。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, the 29th day of February is the only leap day. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會比較不同的實作類別。The following code example compares different implementations of the class. remarks.format: 這個方法傳回的日期和時間依據特殊曆法的目前紀元。This method returns a date and time based on the current era of a particular calendar. 針對和，支援根據桃之皇帝，呼叫這個方法的多個紀元可能會產生非預期的日期，時期變更時。For the and , which support multiple eras based on the reign of the emperor, calling this method can produce an unintended date when an era changes. 當具現化使用這些行事曆的日期，我們建議您呼叫或是[JapaneseLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)](xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32))方法且明確地指定的紀元。When instantiating a date using either of these calendars, we recommend that you call the or [JapaneseLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)](xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)) method and explicitly specify an era.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是由兩位數年份的 100 年範圍中的最後一年。is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. 世紀取決於尋找兩位數的唯一相符項目`year`該 100 年範圍內。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit `year` within that 100-year range. 例如，如果設為 2029，100 年範圍為從 1930年 2029年。For example, if is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，30 的 2 位數值會解譯為 1930，而 2 位數為 29 值解譯為 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 如果`year`大於或等於 100，值`year`會原封不動地傳回。If `year` is greater than or equal to 100, the value of `year` is returned unchanged. 支援的兩位數年份或四位數年份。supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 傳遞的兩位數年份值 (小於 100) 會導致方法將值轉換為四位數字值，根據值，表示適當的世紀。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果應用程式提供支援的行事曆範圍內的四位數年份值，此方法會傳回實際的輸入的值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 應用程式提供四位數字值，超出支援的行事曆的範圍，則會提供為負數值，此方法會擲回例外狀況。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

exception.span: 位於行事曆支援的範圍外。

span.span: is outside the range supported by the calendar.

span.span: The last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性允許的 2 位數年份若要正確轉譯成 4 位數年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 比方說，如果這個屬性設定為 2029年，100 年範圍是從 1930年 2029年。For example, if this property is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，30 的 2 位數值會解譯為 1930，而 2 位數為 29 值解譯為 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 這個屬性的初始值被衍生自 [控制台] 的 [地區及語言選項] 部分中的設定。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 不過，這項資訊可以變更的存留期間。However, that information can change during the life of the . 類別不會偵測系統設定 中的變更會自動。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 行事曆不支援在地區及語言選項中，如果這個屬性的初始值會是所定義的預設值類別。If the calendar is not supported in the regional and language options, the initial value of this property is the default value defined by the class. 您的應用程式應該將這個值表示純粹 2 位數字年份 99。Your application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 比方說，如果這個屬性設定為 99，100 年範圍是從 0 （不是有效值大部分的行事曆） 到 99。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，30 的 2 位數值會解譯為 30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.
